title: Represent and analyze x-t graph to a-t equation

content.description: An object is moving in simple harmonic motion. The graph shows the object’s position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> </math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>.
content.question:
Which of the following expressions, where <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is a positive constant, best represents the object’s acceleration <math alttext="lowercase a, of t" overflow="scroll"> <mi>a</mi> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>t</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math> and also provides sufficient supporting evidence?

Expression
 Supporting Evidence

A
 <math alttext="negative lowercase a, sub 0, end sub, times the sine of open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times t, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 This expression is proportional to <math alttext="x of t" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and opposite in sign.

B
 <math alttext="negative lowercase a, sub 0, end sub, times the sine of open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times t, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 This expression is periodic with the same period as<math alttext="x of t" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.

C
 <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 0, end sub, times the cosine of open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times t, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 This expression is proportional to the slope of the <math alttext="x of t" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> graph.

D
 <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 0, end sub, times the cosine of open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, times t, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 This expression is zero whenever <math alttext="x of t" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is either at a maximum or a minimum.
